justification: Good read on Team B: values upside, dual-threat QB, young ascending pieces, and has TE depth (Taylor), making Liam expendable. Offer fits B’s needs (QB, elite WR) and tolerance for minor injury. However, it barely addresses Team A’s aims; no explicit nod to A offloading variance/injury or RB depth needs. Calling Liam a “sell high” is questionable given declining role. Overall coherent and plausible, but rationale is thin and slightly imprecise.
